## Day 1 – Project setup

**Date:** Jan 26

**What I did:**

- Installed key packages: devtools, usethis, roxygen2, testthat, httr2, jsonlite, dplyr, tidyr, ggplot2
- Initialized package structure with `usethis::create_package()`
- Set package name: **wbmacro**
- Added MIT license for the group
- Updated README to Rmd format
- Filled in DESCRIPTION (title, description, authors, dependencies)
- Created placeholder .R files: indicators.R, countries.R, data.R

**Decisions:**

- Using tidyverse-style packages for clean, analysis-ready output
- MIT license – simple and open

## Day 2 – Core functions: search, countries, data fetch

**Date:** Jan 27

**What I did:**

- Implemented `wb_search_indicators()` to search indicators by keyword (httr2 + JSON parsing → tidy tibble)
- Created `wb_countries()` with pagination loop, filters (exclude aggregates, income groups)
- Built main `wb_fetch()` function for time-series data (multi-indicator/country/year support, pagination)
- Tested all functions with real examples (e.g. GDP per capita & population for China/Canada/USA)
- Added basic error handling and informative messages

**Decisions:**

- Pagination essential for both countries (~300 entries) and large data fetches
- Kept functions simple but user-friendly (validation, defaults)

**Commits:**

- "wb_search_indicators function"
- "wb_countries with pagination and filtering"
- "core wb_fetch function with pagination"
